statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: SHAMROCK OFFICE SOLUTIONS CLASSIC AT MORAGA CA

article.headline: Cal St.-Fullerton 103, Furman 72
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Cal State Fullerton set school and tournament records by hitting 15 3-point attempts in its victory over winless Furman 103-72 on Friday night. Josh Akognon hit seven of 13 3-point attempts and scored 31 points to lead the Titans (7-3) to an easy victory in which they never trailed. Scott Cutley added 22 points as Fullerton was never seriously challenged, even though Furman (0-11) shot 50 percent from the floor. Fullerton shot 52.7 percent, including 50 percent from 3-point range. Frank Robinson scored 17 and Marcio Lassiter, who hit all three 3-point attempts, had 11 points from off the bench. Junior Alex Opacic, Furman's only upper class starter with three freshmen and a sophomore, led the Paladins with 19 points. Freshman Justin Dehm, normally a starter, scored 15. Fullerton also dominated the boards with 40 rebounds, including eight by Marcus Morgan, to Furman's 22. The 15 3-pointers surpassed the previous Fullerton record of 14, set three times against Cal Poly San Luis Obispo, UC Irvine and Southern California. The previous Shamrock Office Solutions Classic tournament record for 3-pointers was 12 set by Belmont against Rice in 2006. The previous tournament scoring record was 93 by host Saint Mary's against Western Carolina in 2006.
